Title: The Scale Revolution in Physics: Historical and Philosophical Perspectives

The RESCALE project proposes an innovative, interdisciplinary investigation into the profound implications of the scale-based theoretical practice that has come to dominate modern physics. By integrating historical and philosophical approaches, this project will illuminate the epistemological transformation that has occurred in physics since the 1950s, as theories have increasingly been developed to operate at specific scales. Our aims are fourfold: to understand how the ideal of a final theory has shaped modern physics and its philosophical interpretations; to examine the shift towards scale-based theories; to explore how philosophers must adapt their interpretative practices in this new context; and to elucidate the resulting world picture from a scale-based perspective. Through historical study of the evolution of scale-based theoretical practice and philosophical analysis of its implications, RESCALE will reveal the far-reaching consequences of this transformation for our understanding of representation, reduction, realism, and metaphysics at the frontiers of science. By shedding light on these fundamental issues, RESCALE will make a significant contribution to our understanding of the nature of scientific knowledge and its relationship to the world.

Title: The Scale Revolution in Physics: Historical and Philosophical Perspectives (RESCALE)

The RESCALE project undertakes a comprehensive historical and philosophical examination of the recent transformation in physics towards scale-based theoretical practice. This shift, evident since the 1950s, has led to theories that operate effectively only at specific scales, challenging the ideal of a final, universal theory. Our project aims to understand the implications of this revolution for our understanding of the world and the practice of philosophy.

Through a combined historical and philosophical approach, we will investigate how the ideal of a final theory has influenced modern physics and its philosophical interpretations. We will examine the evolution of scale-based theories in physics, from the 1950s to the present, and analyze the resulting world picture from a scale-based perspective. Our research will explore the epistemological, metaphysical, and representational implications of this shift, addressing questions about reduction, realism, and the nature of scientific representation.

The RESCALE project is crucial for revealing a fundamental epistemological transformation in the recent history of science, with far-reaching consequences for our understanding of the world. By examining the historical and philosophical dimensions of scale-based physics, we will provide a nuanced understanding of the complex hierarchy of overlapping layers that structure our understanding of reality. Our research will have significant implications for the philosophy of science, metaphysics, and epistemology, and will inform ongoing debates about the nature of scientific inquiry and the limits of human knowledge.
